edges.label: 1. Subject of Investigation
edges.tooltip: Pristina International Airport was the main focus of the corruption investigation.

edges.label: 2. Applicable Law
edges.tooltip: The investigation was conducted under the framework of UNMIK Regulation 1999/24.

edges.label: 3. Violation Identified
edges.tooltip: The investigation found violations of UN Staff Regulations 1.2 (b).

edges.label: 4. Violation Identified
edges.tooltip: Misconduct was identified as per Staff Rule 110.1.

edges.label: 5. Initial Oversight
edges.tooltip: Pillar II initially oversaw operations at Pristina International Airport until June 2002.

edges.label: 6. Subsequent Oversight
edges.tooltip: Oversight responsibility shifted to KTA and Pillar IV in June 2002.

edges.label: 7. Subsequent Oversight
edges.tooltip: Pillar IV, along with KTA, took over oversight responsibilities in June 2002.

Pristina International Airport: Overcharging of commercial flights for fees.
Improper accounting of handling and landing fees.
Requests for corrupt payments for convenient landing slots.

UN Staff Regulations 1.2 (b): Staff members failed to uphold the highest standards of efficiency, competence, and integrity.
Staff Rule 110.1: Misconduct due to failure to observe standards of conduct.
